description:
As a developer
  I want to initialize a new RuleStack project in an empty directory
  So that I can start creating and managing rule packages

steps.name: I am in an empty directory
the default package name should be "example-rules"
core rules should be downloaded to ".rulestack/core.v1.0.0"
I am in an empty directory
the "rulestack.json" file should be valid JSON
the manifest should have the following structure:
I am in an empty directory
the following files and directories should exist:
I am in an empty directory
I am in an empty directory

name: Initialize RFH project in empty directory

description:
As a developer
  I want to understand how RFH init behaves with existing files
  So that I can work with existing projects correctly

elements.name: Initialize in directory with existing rulestack.json

steps.name: I am in an empty directory
I should see "RuleStack project already initialized"
the existing "rulestack.json" should not be overwritten
I am in an empty directory
I am in an empty directory

name: Initialize RFH project with existing files

description:
As a developer
  I want to manage multiple registry configurations
  So that I can work with different package repositories

steps.name: I have a clean config file
I run "rfh registry add production https://registry.example.com"
I should see "Set as active registry"
I should see "Use 'rfh auth login' to authenticate"
the config should contain registry "production" with URL "https://registry.example.com"
"production" should be the current active registry
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I run "rfh registry add staging https://staging.example.com"
the config should contain both registries
I have a clean config file
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I should see "production" in the registry list
I should see "https://registry.example.com" in the registry list
I should see "production" marked as active
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
I should see both registries in the list
I should see "staging" marked as active
I should not see "production" marked as active
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
I should see "Set 'staging' as active registry"
"staging" should be the current active registry
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
the config should not contain registry "production"
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
I should see a warning about setting a new active registry
I have a clean config file
I should see an error about registry not found
the command should exit with non-zero status
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I run "rfh registry add production https://different.example.com"
the config should contain registry "production" with URL "https://different.example.com"

name: Registry Management
